page.title: 19A Village at Play
page.content: Stibbard is a lively village with much of the activity centred around the Drama Group, the Womens'Institute and the Playing Field Committee. In addition to its regular Play-readings, there is a Junior production each spring and a Stibbard Players' production in September. In July, to raise funds, the same group hold a Social evening. The Playing Field Committee holds Cricket and Rounders Matches - adults against children - once a year in the Summer, and Indoor Games Evenings in the Village Hall, and this year (1985) challenged Great Ryburgh to an 'It's a Knockout' competition{(See Photo {Section).} There is an annual village Harvest Supper and a W.I. Christmas Party. Finally, Church and Chapel alike hold fund-raising Fetes, all well supported by the whole village.
